ARABIC: قَالَ يَٰهَٰرُونُ مَا مَنَعَكَ إِذْ رَأَيْتَهُمْ ضَلُّوٓا۟

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: He said, 'What prevented you following me, Harun, when you saw that they had gone astray?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: But (Moses) said: "O Aaron, when you saw that they had gone astray, what hindered you
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: (After rebuking his people) Moses turned to Aaron and said: "Aaron! What prevented you, when you saw them going astray,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Then Moses asked Aaron, "What made you not follow me when you saw them in error?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Said Moosa, “O Haroon – what prevented you when you saw them going astray?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: (Musa) said: "O Harun! What prevented you when you saw them going astray;"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: (Musa) said: O Haroun! what prevented you, when you saw them going astray,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Moses said, 'What prevented thee, Aaron, when thou sawest them in error,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: He (Moses) said: O Aaron! What held thee back when thou didst see them gone astray,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Moses said to Aaron, "What prevented you, when you saw that they had gone astray,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Musa said: O Harun! what prevented thee, when thou sawest them going astray.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: He said, ‘O Aaron! What kept you, when you saw them going astray,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: (Moses) said: "O Aaron! what kept thee back, when thou sawest them going wrong,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: [Musa (Moses)] said: "O Harun (Aaron)! What stopped you when you saw them going astray;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: He (Moses) said to Aaron: 'When you saw them in error, what prevented you,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: He said, “O Aaron, what prevented you, when you saw them going astray.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: [Moses] said, "O Aaron, what prevented you, when you saw them going astray,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [20:92] He, Moses, said, upon his return, ‘O Aaron, what held you back when you saw them going astray, by worshipping it,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: When Moses returned, (He said) to Aaron: (O Aaron! What held thee back when thou didst see them gone astray) from the right way,
